channel.title: Hello there
channel.description:
Hello i've been wondring on something i have made a jad minigame with waves. Even jad isen't aggresive, it just hit once they it stop attacking/ being aggresive. when we spawn jad with doing ::npc ingame it get aggresive, so i don't really understand this.
base: project insanity

item.title: Hello there
item.dc:creator: @Chaotic-Madness Chaotic-Madness
item.description:
@Chaotic-Madness wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:3, topic:428321”][code=java]
package npc.aggressive;

public final class NPC {

/**
 * The '1' represents the id of the npc you wish to be aggressive
 */
private int npcId = 1;

/**
 * if 'j' equals 'npcID' and its returned true, the NPC is aggressive.
 * if 'j' equals 'npcId' and its returned false, the NPC is NOT aggressive By
 * By default NPC's are returned false, (non-aggressive)
 */
public boolean isNpcAggressive(int j) {
if (j == npcId) {
    return true;
}
return false;
}

}
[/code][/quote]

You guys are angels

Read full topic

item.title: Hello there
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

package npc.aggressive;

public final class NPC {

    /**
     * The '1' represents the id of the npc you wish to be aggressive
     */
    private int npcId = 1;

    /**
     * if 'j' equals 'npcID' and its returned true, the NPC is aggressive.
     * if 'j' equals 'npcId' and its returned false, the NPC is NOT aggressive By
     * By default NPC's are returned false, (non-aggressive)
     */
    public boolean isNpcAggressive(int j) {
	if (j == npcId) {
	    return true;
	}
	return false;
    }

}

Read full topic

item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Stop making a new thread when you don’t get your answer right away.

PI

You just need to look at the methods, there’s probably even a handler for it.
